title: Stuck in low silver
body: Well I have been stuck in low silver for a while (silver 4) I did reach 100LP but failed my promos. Horribly. Any kind of help would be appreiciated

replies.body: {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Drop everything you're doing and just play Janna.  Ticket outta Silver.
I dont find Janna to be fun. I find gp and other top laners to be very fun to play.
Yeah Janna is boring af to play, but she's infinitely easier to climb with than most other champions.  If you don't mind playing boring champions for free wins, then Janna is the champ for you.
Well I can say I will pass on Janna :)
What do you play? Roles, champions?
I usually play top lane with Gangplank mainly. I can also play sion top. I can play mid lane, and support. But I dont do too well with jg and adc.

> [{quoted}](name=thecoolzole,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EP5EQNzg,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-08-03T01:57:44.230+0000)
>
> I usually play top lane with Gangplank mainly. I can also play sion top. I can play mid lane, and support. But I dont do too well with jg and adc.

Stop playing GP, that's the first thing. Why? Because he takes a long time to ramp up and most games are over then, and even when you do get to late game, he's been nerfed to where he doesn't do much.

pick a champ you can steamroll with, you have to, to get out of that elo. Assasins, trynd, riven, darius, swain, vlad, even garen are all better options, you steamroll lane then help your team get rift and play around the map.

Buy control wards, and use them. They will help out a lot, if you're top place and blue side place it in the bush that's running along the wall, if you're red side place it in the tri-bush, use your trinket for the rest. This makes sure that if you harrass them when they try to clear it you can retreat to your tower, and it will probably last longer. Vision wins games, especially on gangplank because he has no mobiliy or hard cc, making him vulnerable to ganks, same with Sion, but a little less so. Stare at your mini-map. 

Buy {{item:2031}}, it saves you a lot of gold (which is important on Gangplank) from buying pots every back and you can upgrade it to {{item:2033}} later. 

Try to get 100 cs by at least 15 minutes if you can, 15 minions is equal to 1 kill. You might want to practice csing on champs you play a lot, it might help, go into practice tool and just farm with autos for a while to get a feel for the champs auto attacks. 

Don't try to do crazy LC$ Big Playzz, it probably won't work.  Especially as the midlaner, who often think they are the main character in the anime and that they are the team captain who must flash in and ult to make the winning play (I'm very guilty of this). 

If you're facing a hard matchup (Say Riven, Fiora or Pantheon) don't try to kill them unless you are 100% sure you can. Just be very passive and try to freeze the lane close to your tower, and outscale them. As Gangplank, use your ult around the map to pick up kills and assists so they will fall behind you. 

If you see 2 people arguing, mute both of them and wait 5 minutes. Unmute them and see if they shut up. If they don't and it escalated, report them after and mute them again. Saves you from being tilted. 

After every game, analyze it to see how you won or how you lost. Find the cause, and either fix it if you lost or do it more if you won. 

After a loss, take at least a 30 minute break to relax.

Oh yeah im very fond of the "I am bjerg-faker-dopa guy I can 1v5", but I tend to be a bit safer during team fights...sometimes. Sometimes. Because barrel placements.  I always do /mute all wen I start a game.
I personally can't recommend the /mute all thing, it might just make people mad because they think you are ignoring them. And while chat can be just cesspool, it can help.
Well I forgot to add I mute all when I am somewhat tilted... which is a lot.
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
I can basically play every roll, but I cannot adc no matter what I play.

Focus on 2 of them. Mathematically speaking, you're going to get better at a specific role based on the amount of time invested in playing that role. Spreading yourself out will prevent you from really improving at any of them. 

I will note that it's easier to carry with Mid and Jungle, but I also think those two roles are the most difficult to play.
I don't really spread myself apart from any other roles. I mainly play top gangplank or just top lane in general. I only play other rolls if I get autofilled.
I don't recommend Gangplank just because of how easy it is to lose with him. You're going to get destroyed early, and probably dove a lot since you play him top.
The key to not lose early is to not play agressive.  I dont really get dove often  unless im below 10% hp
Good plan. You really only need two roles to be fine. Once you know those, the rest will be learned easy.
Don't have him learn Nasus.... That champ promotes bad macro play.
or stay top lane and get the best stacks anyone has ever gotten in the history of league :^)
farm, freeze lane, bully the enemy if they let you. group, don't chase, take objectives.
bite on a belt. and let out the tears because one never leaves that area
Hey, that't not true. I climbed out of that shit-show and now s2. It ain't much better, but it isn't as bad.
Im in silver two and i truly am the most stuck i have been all season

You're win rate is good, if you just keep playing you'll slowly climb. Look into runes as you are running sub-optimal ones, for GP you can just run AD reds and quins, armor yellow, and mr blues. All of those are cheap and will be refunded at end of season with rune rework. Try out meditation instead of dangerous game if you are running into mana problems in lane as GP. You can also run 12 points in resolve instead of ferocity if you are in a lane where you can get bullied easily. Look up some other builds and situational items on GP.
Thanks I will try it!
